abstract.text: The KLOE-2 detector records decays of quantum-entangled pairs of neutral kaons produced in decays of φ mesons provided by the DAΦNE accelerator at the Laboratori Nazionali di Frascati, Italy.
This system allows for a broad range of studies of fundamental discrete symmetries including tests which are only feasible with entangled neutral mesons.
This work reports on the Lorentz non-invariance and CPT violation searches with the φ → K S K L → π + π − π + π − process in the framework of the Standard Model Extension.
Moreover, status and results of quantum coherence tests with the same process are discussed.
Finally, the status of ongoing direct tests of T and CPT in neutral kaon transitions is presented.
For each of the reported studies, perspectives are discussed for the KLOE-2 experiment, which is presently taking data.

body_text.text: Introduction

Systems of flavoured neutral mesons have long proven to constitute an excellent ground for studies of the fundamental discrete symmetries of Nature as conservation of the latter can be easily translated to constraints on the properties of such systems.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: Among them, neutral kaons are of special importance as the value of the mass difference between K 0 andK 0 state enables the use of quantum-entangled pairs of neutral K mesons to observe a range of quantum intereference phenomena.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: Such interferometric measurements may also be used to design tests of discrete symmetries and quantum mechanics as has been shown by the KLOE experiment, which to date is the sole experimental setup where K 0K0 pairs are available in a quantum entangled state, provided by the DAΦNE φ-factory.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: Presently, the physics programme is continued by the KLOE-2 detector.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: This work reports on the recent tests of both discrete symmetries and quantum coherence performed by KLOE and the perspectives for KLOE-2 results.

body_text.text: The KLOE-2 setup at the DAΦNE φ-factory
The KLOE-2 detector records decays of φ mesons produced in e + e − collisions by the DAΦNE collider operating in the National Laboratories of Frascati in Italy.
body_text.section: The KLOE-2 setup at the DAΦNE φ-factory

body_text.text: The detection setup common for KLOE and KLOE-2 consists of a cylindrical drift chamber (DC) [1] and a sampling electromagnetic calorimeter (EMC) surrounding it with a coverage of 98% of 4π [2].
body_text.section: The KLOE-2 setup at the DAΦNE φ-factory

body_text.text: The DC uses a light gas mixture to minimize kaon regeneration and its size with an outer radius of 2 m is driven by the need to detect a large part (40%) of decays of the K L mesons, whose mean path in KLOE is about 3.4 m.
body_text.section: The KLOE-2 setup at the DAΦNE φ-factory

body_text.text: The calorimeter provides good timing resolution which is used to reconstruct the K L → 3π 0 → 6γ decays based on the γ interaction points in the EMC [3].
body_text.section: The KLOE-2 setup at the DAΦNE φ-factory

body_text.text: Additionally, the KLOE-2 uses a novel Inner Tracker device based on 4 layers of Cylindrical Gas Electron Multiplier detector aiming at improving tracking and vertexing resolution close to the interaction point [4].

body_text.text: 5. Test of time-reversal and CPT symmetry in neutral kaon transitions with φ → K S K L → πeν 3π 0 (2π) decays
body_text.section: Search for CPT and Lorentz symmetry violation with the

body_text.text: A novel concept of direct tests of discrete symmetries in neutral kaon transitions is presently pursued at KLOE-2 for the T and CPT symmetries.
body_text.section: Search for CPT and Lorentz symmetry violation with the

body_text.text: The test uses kaon transitions between their pure flavour {K 0 ,K 0 } and CPdefinite states {K + , K − } and is based on a comparison between rates of processes like K 0 → K − and their time-reversal conjugates obtained by an exchange of initial and final states [14,15].
body_text.section: Search for CPT and Lorentz symmetry violation with the

body_text.text: The kaon states are identified by semileptonic decays K 0 → π − e + ν and K 0 → π + e −ν as well as hadronic decays into two (K + → π + π − ) and three pions (K − → 3π 0 ).
body_text.section: Search for CPT and Lorentz symmetry violation with the

body_text.text: Initial state of the kaon in the compared transitions is inferred from the decay of its quantum-entangled partner, a technique which is only possible at DAΦNE in the case of neutral K mesons.

body_text.text: Summary and perspectives

Although the KLOE detector has already provided numerous contributions to the tests of fundamental discrete symmetries such as the CPT and Lorentz symmetries and the foundations of Quantum Mechanics through decoherence searches, KLOE data are still exploited to provide more precise results as in the case of the decoherence parameter estimation.
body_text.section: Summary and perspectives

body_text.text: Moreover, a novel test of time reversal and CPT symmetries is in progress using the data collected by the KLOE-2 detector, which is presently in operation.
body_text.section: Summary and perspectives

body_text.text: KLOE-2 will bring not only larger statistics of at least 5 fb −1 but also improved event reconstruction due to new detector components such as the Inner Tracker.
body_text.section: Summary and perspectives

body_text.text: These factors are expected to improve sensitivity of all the reported tests.
